NoProjectOpen.message: No Citavi project is currently open.

NoResultsWereFoundForTheseCriteria.message: No results were found for these criteria.

OptionsDialogHunterInfo.message: The Citavi Hunter helps the Picker detect references that can be imported from certain online databases (PubMed, Google Scholar, ArXiv.org). When search results are found, click the blue bar at the bottom of the page to add the references to your Citavi project.

OptionsDialogHunterTitle.message: Automatically detect search results on webpages.

OptionsDialogISBNCheckBox.message: Enable identifier detection (ISBN, DOI, PubMed, PMCID, arXiv) and display Picker symbol.

OptionsDialogISBNInfo.message: Citavi can detect identifiers (ISBN, DOI, PubMed, PMCID, arXiv) on webpages. Click the Picker symbol to send the item to your Citavi project. In Citavi you can select the catalogs that should be used for the ISBN search by clicking Tools > Options > Search.

OptionsDialogShowImportMsgboxInfo.message: Display a notification when the Picker successfully transfers information to Citavi.

Panel_Settings_AlreadyInProject_AutoShow.message: If an article with the same DOI is already in the project, the reference will be automatically shown when the Picker symbol is clicked.

Panel_Settings_EnableTrace_Text.message: Only enable this option if you are asked to do so by the Citavi support team.

Panel_Settings_Hunter_Text.message: The Citavi Hunter helps the Picker detect references that can be imported from certain online databases.

Panel_Settings_ImportPdf_Text.message: Citavi will save the PDFs it can find in your project.

Panel_Settings_LookupBibliography_Text.message: When this option is selected, any cited references that are found can be imported along with the original item.

Panel_Settings_MsgBox_Text.message: Display a notification when the Picker successfully transfers information to Citavi.

Panel_Settings_ReferenceIdentifier_Text.message: Citavi can detect identifiers (ISBN, DOI, PubMed, PMCID, arXiv) on webpages. Click the Picker symbol to import the item into Citavi.
